Search open Request a sample Leadership James Huang Senior Vice President, Asia Pacific James Huang joined Advancion in February 2019 and leads the company’s Customer Application Centers in Shanghai and Singapore, including the Asia Pacific sales, technical service and marketing teams. Prior to joining Advancion, Huang most recently served as the Greater China Sales Director for paints and coatings for Ashland. In this role, he was responsible for leading solid growth for the business by implementing a customer-centric market approach and optimizing the company’s regional distribution model. Previously, he held the role of China Sales Manager for Ashland’s personal care business, as well as a number of commercial leadership, sales and marketing and technical roles at GE and National Starch, among others. Huang holds a bachelor’s degree in polymer chemistry from Tianjin University, and an executive M.B.A. from the Carlson School of Management at the University of Minnesota. Search open Request a sample Careers Come join our winning team As the only company in the world that does what we do, Advancion offers opportunities not found anywhere else. We are always looking for the best people, fully aligned with our vision and mission, to serve our customers and add fresh thinking. To apply, email your resume to careers@advancionsciences.com . Advancion Is an Equal Opportunity Employer The employment policy of Advancion Corporation (“Advancion”) is to provide equal opportunity to all persons. Our company has made a commitment to equal employment opportunity through a positive and continuing affirmative action program. No employee or applicant for employment will be discriminated against because of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, military and / or veteran status, or any other Federal or State legally-protected classes. Advancion will recruit, hire, train and promote qualified individuals in all job titles, and ensure that all other personnel actions are administered without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, military and / or veteran status, or disability in accordance with Executive Order 11246, Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended, and the Vietnam Era Veterans Readjustment Assistance Act of 1974, which require affirmative action to ensure equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. Advancion does not discriminate on the basis of national origin or citizenship status as provided under the Immigration Reform and Control Act of 1986. Strictly Necessary Cookies These cookies are necessary for us to provide a reliable and functional website for you to use and cannot be switched off in our system. All data is anonymous, therefore, we cannot gather or store any of your personal information via cookies. If you wish to completely disable cookies via your browser, please find out more at our Privacy page. Enable or Disable Cookies Analytics Analytical cookies are used to understand how visitors interact with the website. These cookies help provide information on metrics the number of visitors, bounce rate, traffic source, etc. Enable or Disable Cookies Please enable Strictly Necessary Cookies first so that we can save your preferences! Search open Request a sample DISCOVER THE LEGACY History A global leader in specialty ingredients and consumables dedicated to improving the quality of life through products and expertise that serve the world’s most essential industries From humble beginnings in a Purdue University laboratory to a leading global position in specialty chemistries, our story is defined by a commitment to continuous innovation. Today, leveraging decades of experience developing and safely producing nitroalkane technologies, Advancion delivers a broad range of specialty ingredients that provide customers with multifunctional performance benefits, while meeting or exceeding stringent regulations regarding volatile organic compounds (VOCs) and biodegradability, as well as the quality and purity requirements of the highly regulated markets we serve. By investing in new product and process development, and capacity expansions, Advancion continues to underwrite the fast-growing, global demand for our specialty chemistries with fully integrated, dual-source manufacturing capabilities at our Sterlington, Louisiana, and Ibbenbüren, Germany, production facilities, ensuring worldwide security of supply for customers. Corporate Milestones Investments in Innovation 1934 First patent granted for a batch process and continuous-flow reaction to produce nitroparaffins 1935 Commercial Solvents Corporation (CSC) enters licensing agreement for patented nitration process with Purdue 1940 CSC begins commercial nitroparaffin production 1955 Start-up of first commercial batch-manufacturing plant for TRIS AMINO™ and precursor raw materials in Sterlington, Louisiana 1963 Patent granted for the continuous TRIS AMINO crystallization process and manufacturing technology in Sterlington 1970 Patent granted for dual stage purification process of TRIS AMINO; purity specifications increased to 99.8% 1974 Company completes expansion to Europe with opening of a new production facility in Ibbenbüren, Germany for manufacturing amino alcohols and other nitroparaffin derivatives 1975 International Minerals and Chemical Corporation (IMC) purchases CSC and creates separate nitroparaffins division 1982 Alberta Natural Gas buys nitroparaffins business, forming ANGUS Chemical Company 1992 ANGUS moves into new corporate headquarters and research and development (R&D) center in Buffalo Grove, Illinois 1995 ANGUS purchases facility in Niagara Falls, New York focused on products for the Life Sciences market, and creates a separate ANGUS Buffers and Biochemicals division (ABB) 1996 ANGUS commissions a new pilot plant in Sterlington dedicated to new derivatives and process improvements serving both R&D and developmental production scales 1997 Start-up of dedicated cGMP TRIS AMINO™ Ultra Pure batch manufacturing facility in Sterlington 1999 ANGUS purchased by The Dow Chemical Company 1999 Introduction of TRIS AMINO™ Ultra Pure USP grade 2005 Introduction of new, high-purity grade of aminomethyl propanol, AMP-ULTRA™ PC, enabling formulators of beauty and personal care products to comply with increasingly stringent global cosmetics directives 2008 ANGUS completes construction of a multimillion-dollar Market Development Facility in Sterlington, Louisiana, manufacturing site and helps validate the new-to-the world molecules the company is developing with its unique nitration process 2008 ANGUS launches AEPD™ VOX 1000, a multifunctional amino alcohol for waterborne paints and coatings, and other applications, which is classified as a non-VOC in Europe and Asia Pacific and considered a low-VOC additive in the rest of the world 2010 Introduction of CORRGUARD™ EXT, a multifunctional additive specifically designed to extend the life of high-performance metalworking fluids 2014 Effective June 25, 2014, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) officially removed the company’s flagship AMP™ multifunctional additive (aminomethyl propanol) from the Clean Air Act’s list of volatile organic compounds (VOCs). AMP is the only amine approved by the EPA for VOC exemption 2015 Golden Gate Capital, a private equity investment firm with more than $15 billion of committed capital under management, purchases ANGUS with a look toward long-term growth, expanded capacity, continued R&D and excellent customer service through a global network of Customer Application Centers 2016 ANGUS establishes dedicated Life Sciences business to support the unique needs of the market; expansion of cGMP manufacturing capacity for TRIS AMINO™ Ultra Pure in Sterlington 2019 Start-up of new TRIS AMINO™ AC Advanced Crystal continuous manufacturing capacity in Ibbenbüren, Germany; commercial launch of TRIS AMINO™ AC buffers; opened new Life Sciences warehouse, QC laboratory, and filling / packaging center in Sterlington 2020 Ardian, a world leading private investment house, acquires a 50-percent ownership stake in ANGUS from Golden Gate Capital at a total enterprise value of approximately $2.25 billion 2022 ANGUS acquires Expression Systems, LLC; completes expansion of the Sterlington manufacturing facility and launches commercial production of TRIS AMINO™ Hydrochloride (HCl) and HEPES buffers; launch of a new portfolio of natural botanical extracts for the Home and Personal Care market 2023 ANGUS Chemical Company completes corporate rebrand and name change to Advancion, a new name that captures the essential nature of the ingredients and expertise provided by the Company 2023 Expression Systems, an Advancion company, introduces ESF AdvanCD™ chemically defined insect cell culture medium and the rhabdovirus-free Sf9 RV-Free Insect Cell Line for enhanced risk mitigation and productivity for producers of recombinant proteins, adeno-associated viruses (AAV) and virus-like particles (VLP); Advancion launches new-to-market multifunctional etheramine, DMMOPA, for waterborne industrial coatings systems; Company begins commercial production of HEPES sodium salt buffer 2024 Advancion introduces a new, bio-based multifunctional amino alcohol specifically developed for use in beauty and personal care applications. The new ingredient, exclusively manufactured by Advancion, is 50% bio-based and provides exceptional performance, including high-efficiency neutralization, emulsion stabilization and pigment dispersion. Search open Request a sample Leadership Ernest Green Senior Vice President, Manufacturing and Engineering Ernest Green joined Advancion in 1986, progressing through a wide variety of roles including electrical and instrumentation maintenance, electrical and instrumentation engineering, site maintenance leader, production leader and site leader. Prior to joining Advancion, Green was a field service engineer for General Electric Field Services. An active and engaged community leader, Green serves on a wide variety of professional organizations and community affairs including the Boards of Directors of the Louisiana Chemical Industry Alliance, United Way of Northeast Louisiana and the Louisiana Purchase Council of the Boy Scouts of America. He is also on the Process Technology Advisory Board for the Louisiana Delta Community College in Monroe, the Louisiana Community & Technical College System Foundation Board and the Louisiana Tech College of Engineering Foundation Board. Green holds a bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering technology from Louisiana Tech University and received their Distinguished Alumnus Award in 2014. Search open Request a sample Leadership Liam Doherty Executive Vice President, Global Life Sciences and Europe, Middle East, Africa & India Liam Doherty leads the global Life Sciences business as well as Europe, Middle East, Africa and India Customer Application Centers, including the regional sales, technical service and marketing teams. A 26-year veteran of Advancion, Doherty joined the company in 1999 and has led a career spanning roles in sales and marketing, product management and regional commercial leadership with a particular focus in the personal care industry. Prior to Advancion, he served as a process research engineer for Dow. Doherty holds a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from the University of Bradford in England. Search open Request a sample Leadership David Neuberger President and Chief Executive Officer David Neuberger joined Advancion as President and Chief Executive Officer in January 2018. Neuberger, a chemical industry veteran, has more than 20 years of experience in a variety of leadership roles in executive management, finance, corporate development, marketing and investor relations. Prior to joining Advancion, Neuberger most recently served as Group Vice President for the Pharmaceutical, Agriculture and Nutrition Specialties business for Ashland, a leading, global specialty chemical company. In this role, he was responsible for managing Ashland’s most profitable P&L, as well as a global pipeline of new product introductions. Neuberger previously served as Vice President for Ashland’s North American Industrial Specialties business, with leadership responsibility for all commercial, technical service and supply chain functions. His previous experience includes senior management roles in research and development, operations, marketing and finance while at WR Grace. Neuberger holds a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from Johns Hopkins University and an M.B.A. from The Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania where he was named a Palmer Scholar. Search open Request a sample Leadership Kumar Ramanathan, Ph.D. Senior Vice President, Product Management and Pricing Kumar Ramanathan joined Advancion in October 2018 and is responsible for the core strategic elements of the company’s product portfolio, including global pricing and basic chemical strategy. Prior to Advancion, he most recently served as Director, Global Marketing and Product Management for Ashland’s Industrial Specialties business, covering coatings, adhesives, construction, and energy, encompassing more than 20 product lines and $1 billion in annual revenue. In this capacity, he played a critical leadership role in strategy development, price management, product portfolio optimization, asset management and new product introductions. Prior to Ashland, Ramanathan held several roles in engineering, production and commercial/industry management at Ciba Specialty Chemicals. Ramanathan holds a bachelor’s degree in chemical engineering from the Indian Institute of Technology (Bombay, India), as well as a master’s degree and Ph.D. in chemical engineering, both from State University of New York. Search open Request a sample Leadership Michael Lewis Senior Vice President, The Americas Michael Lewis leads the North American and Latin American Customer Application Centers, including the regional  sales, technical service and marketing teams. He has more than 25 years of experience in specialty and commodity chemical sales, commercial leadership and business leadership roles in chemical manufacturing and distribution businesses. Prior to joining Advancion, Lewis served as General Manager at Univar Solutions, a chemical distribution company, where he led business teams in sales, customer service, operations, and commercial functions. His previous experience includes commercial and distribution management positions at Dow and ANGUS Chemical Company. Lewis holds a bachelor’s degree in business administration and marketing from the University of Massachusetts. Search open Request a sample Leadership Walter Keller Chief Financial Officer Walter Keller joined Advancion as Chief Financial Officer (CFO) in October 2024 and oversees the Company’s corporate finance, treasury, financial planning and analysis, tax, investor relations, and risk management activities, as well as the Company’s information technology strategy and function. Keller has 30 years of international finance and operations experience with an extensive background in corporate finance, working capital improvement, strategy development, private equity, and mergers and acquisitions, primarily within the global specialty chemicals sector. Prior to joining Advancion, he served as CFO at Ascensus Specialties, a private equity owned specialty chemical company. In addition, Keller previously served as the CFO for SACHEM, a privately owned specialty chemical manufacturing company, and held leadership roles at Celanese, including CFO for the Acetyl Chain business. Prior to Celanese, he worked for Arthur Andersen and Hoechst AG. Keller is a native of Germany and holds a degree in industrial engineering with an emphasis on mechanical engineering and business administration from Giessen-Friedberg University of Applied Sciences in Friedberg, Germany. title: Dr. Kathleen Havelka – Advancion

Search open Request a sample Leadership Dr. Kathleen Havelka Senior Vice President, Research, Development and Applications Dr. Kathleen Havelka joined Advancion in April 2021 and has overall responsibility for leading the Company’s global Research, Development and Applications (RD&A) group and innovation pipeline. She is a chemical industry veteran with more than 25 years’ experience in numerous leadership roles in global specialty chemical and industrial products organizations. Dr. Havelka joined Advancion from Fuchs Lubricants Company (FLC) where she most recently served as Senior Director of R&D and Quality Control, leading FLC’s technical team in the development and launch of a broad portfolio of high performing fluid and grease technologies. Prior to FLC, she held significant leadership roles in R&D as well as sales and marketing at Elevance Renewable Sciences, Diversey (Johnson-Diversey) and Lubrizol Corporation. She is the inventor on six patents, co-edited three books, authored five book chapters, 35 articles, and presented over 30 invited talks. She has been a member of Society of Tribologists and Lubrication Engineers (STLE) and American Chemical Society (ACS) boards and has received numerous awards. She was recently recognized by STLE with the Frontiers Award for Advances in Wind Turbine Lubrication. She is an ACS Fellow for her outstanding achievements in and contributions to science, the profession, and the Society (a recognition for up to 1% of the ACS membership). Dr. Havelka holds a bachelor’s degree in chemistry from Elmhurst College and a doctorate in chemistry from Northern Illinois University. She also is a Certified Quality Management Lead Auditor for ISO 9001:2015 and IATF 16949:2016.
